attributes.action: Lower State Pension age back to 60 for both men and women
attributes.additional_details:
The #50’s women have been campaigning tirelessly to have their pension lowered back to 60. However, the 50’s women and those that have reached State Pension age should be treated fairly and be able claim their pension at 60 years old.

Furthermore, it is now different ages for a woman and a man. That seems sexist and discriminatory.

The Govt and Parliament need to lower the SP age, stop ignoring the older generation, be fair and equal.
attributes.background:
The Government and Parliament need to lower the State Pension age back to 60 for both men and women.

If the Government do not lower the State Pension age, there needs to be a vote for it in Parliament.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581736
